node.title: 30+ temperatures scorch the North Island
node.description: Hot weather is showing no signs of letting up in the North Island on Tuesday.
node.content: ["Hot weather is showing no signs of letting up in the North Island on Tuesday, with Monday's hottest places in for another scorcher.", "The hottest place in the country yesterday was Kawerau at 33C, while Lower Hutt and Taumaranui were second, both hitting 30.3C.", "MetService meteorologist Tuporo Marsters said they will be in for more of the same, or even hotter.", "\"I think Kawerau will go again in the 30-pluses, Taumarunui will be going for 33C.\"", "Lower Hutt is expected to hit 30C.", "However in the South Island, temperatures are expected to drop, due to a southerly change.", "Invercargill has an expected high of 22C, when it hit 32C just two days ago.", "In the last few days the MetService has been issuing heat alerts for some parts of the country and encouraging people to drink plenty of water, seek some shade and keep an eye on those who are vulnerable to the heat.", "RNZ", "\u00a0"]
